subject: p11413236
Findings: Patient is status post median sternotomy. Right-sided Port-A-Cath tip terminates in the upper SVC, unchanged. Cardiac silhouette remains moderately enlarged but unchanged. Multiple calcified mediastinal lymph nodes are again demonstrated suggestive prior granulomatous disease. The mediastinal and hilar contours are otherwise unremarkable. Lung volumes are persistently low with streaky atelectasis seen in the right lung base. No focal consolidation, pleural effusion or pneumothorax is seen. The pulmonary vasculature is not engorged.
Impression: Persistently low lung volumes with streaky right basilar atelectasis.
